title: Chelsea defender seals Brighton loan switch
text:
Chelsea defender seals Brighton loan switch Getty 0 23 Jan 2017 22:58:14 Fikayo Tomori has moved to the Championship club on a temporary deal until the end of the season 
Chelsea defender Fikayo Tomori has completed a loan move to Championship promotion-chasers Brighton & Hove Albion. 
The 19-year-old will join Brighton for the rest of the 2016-17 season, with the Seagulls currently just one point behind Championship leaders Newcastle United. 
Drogba snubs Australia for Brazil move 
Tomori won Chelsea's Academy Player of the Year last season after helping the Blues retain both the UEFA Youth League and the FA Youth Cup. 
The defender can play at centre-back or right-back, and made his full debut for Chelsea on the last day of the 2015-16 season, coming on for Branislav Ivanovic for the last 30 minutes against Leicester City. 
A former England and Canada underage international, Tomori is also eligible to play for Nigeria. He signed a new four-year-deal at Stamford Bridge which will keep him at the club until at least 2020. The full story on the arrival of Fikayo Tomori from Chelsea. #BHAFC https://t.co/T5gJ3BR9Ag pic.twitter.com/Bkp6BzUCMD â€” BHAFC (@OfficialBHAFC) January 23, 2017 
Brighton manager Chris Hughton is looking forward to seeing his new recruit in action, stating that he will help provide depth at Falmer Stadium. 
"We have brought in Fikayo on loan from Chelsea to provide us with some additional cover in the full-back positions, and we are delighted to welcome him to the club," Hughton told the club's official website. 
"He is a highly-rated young full-back, by both Chelsea and England; he is predominantly a right-back, but he can play in any position across the back four, and will give us good defensive cover for the first-team for the second half of the season. " Related
